intro: Ionidium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the eastern United States. The plants are perennial herbs with basal leaves that are often heart-shaped or arrow-shaped. They produce small, greenish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring. Ionidium species are often found in moist, woodsy areas and are adapted to partial shade.
